programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Beside SUVs, compact and city cars are on the rise. For many people, a Kia Picanto is enough to satisfy their mobility needs. In addition: the Audi A1 offers certain features of the luxury class, but at a much higher price. And: the agile Kia Ceed GT.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Cadillac CTS-V
programme.desc: Those who don’t know about it will only see a dignified sedan but under the hood hides the 649 horse power 6.2 liter V8 supercharged engine of the Corvette Z06. This car is a good alternative to the Audi RS6, BMW M5 and Mercedes E63 AMG.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Röhrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: In the 1930s the famous Silver Arrows by Auto Union that were designed by Ferdinand Porsche celebrated great successes at the European Drivers' Championship and several Grand Prix races despite the strong competition by Mercedes-Benz.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.sub-title: Rallye Year 1972 - A Ford success story
programme.desc: The International Championship for Manufacturers was a rally series which was run from 1970 to 1972. Car manufacturers such as Porsche, Renault, Opel and Ford took part in this competition, with Ford having an exceptionally successful year in 1972.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Mitsubishi Outlander Plug-In Hybrid, the world's first hybrid SUV with two electric motors and a 2-liter combustion engine. Also: the Chevrolet Silverado, an American full-size pickup with a V8 and an average consumption of at least 15 liters.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Bentley EXP 9F and Jaguar C-X17 are concept cars the two manufacturers presented before they started making their own luxury SUVs. Also: how did Toyota, Nissan or Subaru see the future of the SUV? And: Mercedes-Benz' Unimog concept car.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The SUVs Nissan X-Trail and BMW X4 aren't typical offroaders. We witnessed the presentation of the new X-Trail model and BMW's premiere of their X4. Also: the Steinbeißer Trophy, where unusual offroad vehicles take part in a demanding rally.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Volvo XC60
programme.desc: The Swedish landscape is characterized by mountains, forests and lonely roads. Ideal for this off-roader. The Volvo XC60 scores with many safety features and a cool appearance.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1971 BMW 02 Touring was considered an ugly duckling at the time, but is now a coveted car. Also: the solid technology and moderate prices of the Mercedes-Benz 114/115 made them the first "people's Mercedes".

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The Porsche 911 Targa with its lightweight construction is an iconic car. Also: the Lotus Seven Twin Cam SS is more pf a race than a road car. And: the 1930 Bentley Blower and the dainty British roadster, the Sunbeam Tiger.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1967 Ford Fairlane GTA in NASCAR trim. Also: the 1995 Chrysler 300 C was the most powerful production vehicle in the US. And: the 1949 Cadillac Series 62 convertible set new standards in terms of luxury.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1947 Triumph 1800 Roadster provides space for 5 fresh air fans. Also: Le Jog, the toughest classic car rally in Europe. A German women's team takes on the challenge in their VW Iltis. And: a charming oldie, the 1919 Wolseley Stellite.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 1 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 2 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 3 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 4 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 5 of 5)

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: It's very big and mostly comes in orange: the KTM 990 Adventure. Over rough terrain it's often driven standing up. Today, the 990 is considered the off-road specialist among travel Enduros.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: At the Essen Motor Show over 500 exhibitors present the latest highlights from the car tuning scene. Everything can be found here, from accessories available to everyone to handmade sports cars and top class tuning.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Abt Sportsline stands for car tuning at the highest level. Abt's slogan isn't 'from the race track to the road ' for nothing. Also: the Rohte VW Golf R20. And: the BMW Art Car.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: We visited Brabus, the largest independent automobile tuner where you can find more than 9,000 HP in one place. Also: MTM's Audi RS6 Clubsport.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Berlin-based company TH Automobiles equips Volkswagen vans with Porsche engines, turning a T5 into one of the most dynamic large saloon cars in the world.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Conti Tuning Day is themed "Power Sedans" and we take a closer look at the cars on display. Plus: Swiss eccentric Ueli Anliker has built the most expensive Mercedes-AMG SLR in the world, the "Red Gold Dream".

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Gemballa specialises in refining Porsche models, but its portfolio also includes brands such as Ferrari. And: the car tuning company Irmscher turns the Chevrolet Camaro into the 'Irmscher Camaro i42'.

programme.title: Porsche 550 RS Spyder
programme.desc: Small, lightweight, agile and swift as an arrow. Historic image documents of the Porsche 550 RS Spyder.

programme.title: BMW 750i xDrive
programme.desc: The BMW 750i is the second most powerful car in the 7 series. It may be mercilessly overpowered for the daily commute to work, but thanks to this power the two-ton vehicle doesn't feel as heavy as it actually is.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Robust, honest, simple, the Land Rover is the bedrock of all off-road vehicles. Built in 1948 as a simple car for British farmers, the vehicle quickly became an export hit. Today, the Land Rover is at home all over the world.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Vive la différence: the cars of Renault are always unusual in design, exceptional in their driving comfort and often avant-gardistic. Renault writes history with the Dauphine, R4, R5 and R16 models.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: From the very beginning, Citroën celebrated the joy of extravagance. Already the Traction Avant from the 1950s is a milestone in automotive history and the 2CV is one of the most unusual and charming small cars ever built.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Golf is nothing more but a reasonable car - there's nothing really exciting about it, but still it's a mega-seller. The Golf is compatible with the masses and dominates the compact car class since its market introduction.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Be it the 24 Hours of Le Mans, the Monte Carlo Rally or Formula 1: Porsche won it all at least once. Even the first prototype was a race winner, and the successes of the Spyder in the Carrera Panamericana or the Targa Florio are unforgettable.

programme.title: Creme 21 Youngtimer Rally 2019
programme.desc: Welcome to the 80s, the period in time in which there were only three skin creams and three television programs on air and Tuesday night was Dallas night. - Car enthusiasts can feel like they’re back in those times once a year at the Creme 21 classic car rally.

programme.title: Chevrolet Corvair
programme.desc: Despite a production number of nearly 1.4 million units the Chevrolet Corvair is virtually unknown in Europe. It was innovative, efficient, modern and cheap. Nevertheless, it was slandered, torn apart and later reviled.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: In 1964, Ferruccio Lamborghini set himself the goal to build the best sports cars in the world, a bold move, being located only a few kilometers from Ferrari.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: After the Second World War, following in his father's footsteps who had been responsible for the development of the classic Volkswagen, Ferry Porsche laid the foundation for the brand's sports car models like the 356 and later the Porsche 911.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: One cannot talk about rally sports without mentioning the name Walter Röhrl. From an early age, Röhrl showed his talent in rally sports and won the European, World and other international rally championships several times in his career.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Hans-Joachim Stuck is one of the best racing drivers in Germany. Over his long career he not only won the Formula II and several international touring car championships multiple times but also the famous 24-hour race of Le Mans twice.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: A racing team isn't just about driving; it also navigates the uncertainties and pressures of securing crucial sponsorship and financial backing necessary for continued participation in the championship.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: In the season finale at Hockenheim, tensions are high as teams compete for the ADAC GT4 championship. Defending champions Mike David Ortmann and Hugo Sasse face intense pressure after a challenging start to the season.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: Damon Surzyshyn embarks on a new chapter in his racing career, navigating ice racing in Canada before securing an opportunity to compete in Germany’s Nürburgring NLS series. Despite some challenges, he prepares for the legendary Nordschleife.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: Damon Surzyshyn takes on the Nürburgring Nordschleife, navigating the complexities of permit qualifications, unpredictable weather, and intense multi-class racing. Amidst several challenges, he pushes through to secure a strong finish.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: This episode features Action Concept's stunt highlights from all previous specials, from exciting car stunts to meticulously choreographed fight scenes and even some snowmobile shootout action.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: This time, an industrial site is the scene for the stunt extravaganza. The Stunt Heroes' objective: jump through a truck trailer with a car. As usual with such risky car stunts, careful planning, preparation, timing and precision are of the essence.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: In a race between a dump truck and a car, man and machine are brought to their limits. Stuntman Stefan receives a load of gravel for his birthday, instead of confetti.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We present the most affordable hybrid cars. The pioneers are the Japanese, who have a huge selection of these car models on offer.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We take a little journey back in time and trace the development of the modern car and show the ten oldest car companies.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We present ten cars that have achieved cult status and are still adored by numerous fan clubs.
